note.p: Education: Private school; St John's College, Cambridge (matriculated 1673); MB (1679), MD (1685)
Career: Travelled abroad (1679-1684); was a companion of Hans Sloane (FRS 1685) in Paris and corresponded with John Ray (FRS 1667); Physician to the King
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Hunter; Gunther; Munk's roll

Notes: DNB describes him as 'Sir' and in index to Bulloch's Roll it states that he was knighted by George I, but the Kt was a naval man of the same name. Hunter gives 1657 as approximate year of birth.
